sen.j: 打突とは、剣道における技のことである。
sen.e: Datotsu refers to a technique in Kendo (Japanese art of fencing.)
Datotsu refers to a technique in Kendo (Japanese art of fencing.)
Datotsu refers to a technique in Kendo (Japanese art of fencing.)

sen.j: 面、小手、胴、突きの四種がある。
sen.e: It has four types of men, kote, do, and tsuki.
It consists of four types: men, kote, do, and tsuki.
It consists of four types: men, kote, do, and tsuki.
Men
Men
Men

sen.j: 竹刀で頭部を打つ打突のことで、最も基本的な打突である。
sen.e: Men is a type of datotsu to strike a head with a bamboo sword, and is the most basic one.
Men is a type of datotsu to strike a head with a bamboo sword, and is the most basic one.
Men is a type of datotsu to strike a head with a bamboo sword, and is the most basic one.

sen.j: 普通は頭部上方を打つ正面打ちが用いられるが、面の側面左右45°を打つ左右面も存在する。
sen.e: Datotsu has shomen-uchi strike that is generally used for striking the upper part of the head. Datotsu has also sayu-men to strike the right or left side of the men by 45 degrees.
Generally, shomen-uchi strike is used for striking the upper part of the head, while sayu-men is also used to strike the right or left side of the men by 45 degrees.
Generally, shomen-uchi strike is used for striking the upper part of the head, while sayu-men is also used to strike the right or left side of the men by 45 degrees.

sen.j: (主に切り返しや素振りに用いることが多い。）
sen.e: It is often used for kirikaeshi (a practice method of having a shomen-uchi strike and a sayu-men strike one after the other continuously) or practice striking mainly.
It is often used for kirikaeshi (a practice method of having a shomen-uchi strike and a sayu-men strike one after the other continuously) or suburi practice strokes.
It is often used for kirikaeshi (a practice method of having a shomen-uchi strike and a sayu-men strike one after the other continuously) or suburi practice strokes.

sen.j: 相手の手首を打つ打突である。
sen.e: Kote is a type of datotsu to strike a wrist of a partner.
Kote is a type of datotsu to strike a wrist of a partner.
Kote is a type of datotsu to strike a wrist of a partner.
Do
Do
Do

sen.j: 相手の胴の部分を打つ打突である。
sen.e: It is a type of datotsu to strike a part of the trunk of a partner.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is a type of datotsu to strike a part of the trunk of a partner's body.
It is a type of datotsu to strike a part of the trunk of a partner's body.

sen.j: 原則右胴が主流である。
sen.e: Migi-do (strike on the right side of the trunk of the body) is used in most cases in principle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Migi-do (strike on the right side of the trunk of the body) is used in most cases in principle.
Migi-do (strike on the right side of the trunk of the body) is used in most cases in principle.

sen.j: しかし、一時期、面、小手、右胴を隠す三所隠し(または三所よけ)と呼ばれる守り方が横行したため、左胴も用いられるようになった。
sen.e: However, a defense way referred to as midokoro-kakushi (or midokoro-yoke) to guard the men, kote and migi-do was widespread for a period of time, and thus hidari-do has also been used.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, a defense way referred to as midokoro-kakushi (or midokoro-yoke) to guard the men, kote and migi-do was widespread for a period of time, and thus hidari-do has also been used.
However, a defense way referred to as midokoro-kakushi (or midokoro-yoke) to guard the men, kote and migi-do was widespread for a period of time, and thus hidari-do has also been used.

sen.j: 後に戦意のない態度として三所隠しが反則とされるようになったあとでも使用されるようになった。
sen.e: The hidari-do has been used even after it became considered to be a foul for behavior with no fighting spirit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The hidari-do has been used even after it became considered to be a foul for behavior with no fighting spirit.
The hidari-do has been used even after it became considered to be a foul for behavior with no fighting spirit.

sen.j: 相手ののどを突く打突である。
sen.e: It is a type of dadotsu to point out a throat of a partner.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is a type of dadotsu to point out a throat of a partner.
It is a type of dadotsu to point out a throat of a partner.

sen.j: 一応は防具 (剣道)面の突き垂が保護しているものの、外すと危険なので、中学生以下は禁止されている。
sen.e: Although a tsukidare of a men-mask of protector (kendo swordmanship) just covers the throat, use of the tsuki is prohibited for younger than high school students because removal of the mask may lead to some danger.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Although a tsukidare of men-mask, a guard mask of kendo swordmanship, protects the throat, the tsuki is prohibited for junior high school students and younger because it is dangerous if they remove the mask.

Although a tsukidare of men-mask, a guard mask of kendo swordmanship, protects the throat, the tsuki is prohibited for junior high school students and younger because it is dangerous if they remove the mask.
